intro: Chirita crassituba, commonly known as the broad-leaved chirita, is a species of flowering plant in the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant.
